gui package¶

Submodules¶

gui.button module¶

class gui.button.EmailButton(**kwargs)¶

Bases: kivy.uix.button.Button

This Button sends an email with a MIDI attachment.

EmailButton.exportEmail()¶

Creates a pop-up object which sends an email to the specified address.

class gui.button.ExportButton(**kwargs)¶

Bases: kivy.uix.button.Button

This Button exports a score to the MIDI format.

ExportButton.exportMidi()¶

Creates a file explorer popup which allows the user to save the file at the desired location.

class gui.button.PlayButton(**kwargs)¶

Bases: kivy.uix.button.Button

This Button plays a midi file

PlayButton.playFile()¶

Creates a pop-up object which plays the midi file in the application

class gui.button.RecordButton(**kwarg)¶

Bases: kivy.uix.button.Button

Starts and stops a recording and saves the wave file.

RecordButton.toggle()¶

Starts or stops the recording depending of the value of the _recording attributes. When the recording is stopped, the analysis is launched from the ScreenManager.

gui.errorGUI module¶

class gui.errorGUI.ErrorGUI¶

Bases: object

Class handling the display of errors on the user interface.

static ErrorGUI.displayError(errorTitle='Error', message='An error as Ocurred', windowSize=(300, 200))¶

Displays a runtime error on the GUI. params:

errorTitle (str) -> the error’s title message (str) -> the message to display windowSize (tuple) -> the popup’s size. Defaults to (300, 200)
static ErrorGUI.fatalError(errorTitle='Fatal error', message='A critical error as occured', windowSize=(300, 200))¶

Displays a fatal error on the GUI. The application is closed thereafter. params:

errorTitle (str) -> the error’s title message (str) -> the message to display windowSize (tuple) -> the popup’s size

gui.popup module¶

class gui.popup.AnalyzeInterface(parent)¶

Bases: kivy.uix.popup.Popup

Analysis pop-up. Starts the analysis and displays its progression. Can’t be dismissed before the end of the analysis.

AnalyzeInterface.analyze(fileName='temp.wav')¶

Starts the analysis in an other thread. params:

fileName (str) -> the file to analyze
AnalyzeInterface.progression¶

Property that represents a Python object.

Parameters:
defaultvalue: object type

Specifies the default value of the property.

rebind: bool, defaults to False

Whether kv rules using this object as an intermediate attribute in a kv rule, will update the bound property when this object changes.

That is the standard behavior is that if there’s a kv rule text: self.a.b.c.d, where a, b, and c are properties with rebind False and d is a StringProperty. Then when the rule is applied, text becomes bound only to d. If a, b, or c change, text still remains bound to d. Furthermore, if any of them were None when the rule was initially evaluated, e.g. b was None; then text is bound to b and will not become bound to d even when b is changed to not be None.

By setting rebind to True, however, the rule will be re-evaluated and all the properties rebound when that intermediate property changes. E.g. in the example above, whenever b changes or becomes not None if it was None before, text is evaluated again and becomes rebound to d. The overall result is that text is now bound to all the properties among a, b, or c that have rebind set to True.

**kwargs: a list of keyword arguments
baseclass

If kwargs includes a baseclass argument, this value will be used for validation: isinstance(value, kwargs[‘baseclass’]).

Avertissement

To mark the property as changed, you must reassign a new python object.

Modifié dans la version 1.9.0: rebind has been introduced.

Modifié dans la version 1.7.0: baseclass parameter added.

AnalyzeInterface.score¶

Property that represents a Python object.

Parameters:
defaultvalue: object type

Specifies the default value of the property.

rebind: bool, defaults to False

Whether kv rules using this object as an intermediate attribute in a kv rule, will update the bound property when this object changes.

That is the standard behavior is that if there’s a kv rule text: self.a.b.c.d, where a, b, and c are properties with rebind False and d is a StringProperty. Then when the rule is applied, text becomes bound only to d. If a, b, or c change, text still remains bound to d. Furthermore, if any of them were None when the rule was initially evaluated, e.g. b was None; then text is bound to b and will not become bound to d even when b is changed to not be None.

By setting rebind to True, however, the rule will be re-evaluated and all the properties rebound when that intermediate property changes. E.g. in the example above, whenever b changes or becomes not None if it was None before, text is evaluated again and becomes rebound to d. The overall result is that text is now bound to all the properties among a, b, or c that have rebind set to True.

**kwargs: a list of keyword arguments
baseclass

If kwargs includes a baseclass argument, this value will be used for validation: isinstance(value, kwargs[‘baseclass’]).

Avertissement

To mark the property as changed, you must reassign a new python object.

Modifié dans la version 1.9.0: rebind has been introduced.

Modifié dans la version 1.7.0: baseclass parameter added.

AnalyzeInterface.setProgress(*args)¶

Sets the progress of the analysis in a progress bar and label. This method should be executed in Kivy’s main thread and is called when progression has changed. params:

*args -> This method is called automatically and Kivy passes unused params.
AnalyzeInterface.setScore(*args)¶

Sets the score on the current screen and dismisses the popup. This method should be executed by the main Kivy thread and is called when score value has changed params:

*args -> This method is called automatically and Kivy passes unused params.
class gui.popup.EmailInterface(score)¶

Bases: kivy.uix.popup.Popup

Email sender pop up. Allows to send a email containing a midi file.

EmailInterface.email_password¶

Property that represents a string value.

Parameters:
defaultvalue: string, defaults to ‘’

Specifies the default value of the property.
EmailInterface.email_recipient¶

Property that represents a string value.

Parameters:
defaultvalue: string, defaults to ‘’

Specifies the default value of the property.
EmailInterface.email_subject¶

Property that represents a string value.

Parameters:
defaultvalue: string, defaults to ‘’

Specifies the default value of the property.
EmailInterface.send_email()¶

Sends the e-mail at the choosen adress. The sender and receiver use the same adress. Neither adress nor password are saved in the application. The popup is automatically closed after the e-mail has been sent.

class gui.popup.FileInterface(score)¶

Bases: kivy.uix.popup.Popup

FileChooser pop up. Allows to set a location for the MIDI file

FileInterface.getUserInput()¶

Saves the midi file at the choosen location. The file name is completed with a (n) if the choosen name already exists. The popup is automatically closed after the execution of this method

class gui.popup.PlayInterface(score)¶

Bases: kivy.uix.popup.Popup

Midi player popup. Handles the playing of a midi file in the application.

PlayInterface.playMidiFile()¶

Play the MIDI file associated to the score argument. The score is exported to a midi file and played by the application. Then, the file is removed and the pop up is automatically closed.

This code is inspired by https://www.daniweb.com/programming/software-development/code/216979/embed-and-play-midi-music-in-your-code-python.

gui.scorewidget module¶

class gui.scorewidget.MeasureWidget(**kwargs)¶

Bases: kivy.uix.widget.Widget

Displays a score measure. Displays each note and silence on the measure. Uses a bass and treble clef to display score information.

MeasureWidget.LINE_SEPARATION = 10¶
MeasureWidget.NOTES_DIAMETER = 10¶
MeasureWidget.NOTES_LETTER = 'CDEFGAB'¶
MeasureWidget.NOTES_WIDTH = 1.1¶
MeasureWidget.NUMBER_LINE = 5¶
MeasureWidget.OCTAVES_BASS = [1, 2, 3]¶
MeasureWidget.OCTAVES_TREBLE = [4, 5, 6]¶
MeasureWidget.START_LINE_BASS = 130¶
MeasureWidget.START_LINE_TREBLE = 30¶
MeasureWidget.START_STEP = 70¶
MeasureWidget.addCrotchet(pos_x)¶

Displays a Crotchet rest at pos_x params: pos_x (int) -> the x position of the rest

MeasureWidget.addEighth(pos_x, pos_y)¶

Displays an eighth note at pos_x,pos_y params: pos_x (int) -> the x position of the note

pos_y (int) -> the y position of the note
MeasureWidget.addFlat(pos_x, pos_y)¶

Adds a flat transformation beside the note params: pos_x (int) -> the x coordinate of the note

pos_y (int) -> the y coordinate of the note
MeasureWidget.addHalf(pos_x, pos_y)¶

Displays a half note at pos_x,pos_y params: pos_x (int) -> the x position of the note

pos_y (int) -> the y position of the note
MeasureWidget.addMinim(pos_x)¶

Displays a minim at pos_x params:

pos_x (int) -> the x position of the rest
MeasureWidget.addNatural(pos_x, pos_y)¶

Adds a natural transformation beside the note params: pos_x (int) -> the x coordinate of the note

pos_y (int) -> the y coordinate of the note
MeasureWidget.addQuarter(pos_x, pos_y)¶

Displays a quarter note at pos_x,pos_y params: pos_x (int) -> the x position of the note

pos_y (int) -> the y position of the note
MeasureWidget.addQuaver(pos_x)¶

Displays a Quaver rest at pos_x params: pos_x (int) -> the x position of the rest

MeasureWidget.addSemiBreve(pos_x)¶

Displays a semi breve at pos_x params:

pos_x (int) -> the x position of the rest
MeasureWidget.addSemiQuaver(pos_x)¶

Displays a Semi-Quaver rest at pos_x params: pos_x (int) -> the x position of the rest

MeasureWidget.addSharp(pos_x, pos_y)¶

Adds a sharp transformation beside the note params: pos_x (int) -> the x coordinate of the note

pos_y (int) -> the y coordinate of the note
MeasureWidget.addSixteenth(pos_x, pos_y)¶

Displays a sixteenth note at pos_x,pos_y params: pos_x (int) -> the x position of the note

pos_y (int) -> the y position of the note
MeasureWidget.addWhole(pos_x, pos_y)¶

Displays a whole note at pos_x,pos_y params: pos_x (int) -> the x position of the note

pos_y (int) -> the y position of the note
MeasureWidget.completeLine(pos_x, pos_y)¶

Displays all the invisible lines separating the notes and the score params:

pos_x(int) -> x position of the note pos_y(int) -> y position of the note
MeasureWidget.display(*args)¶

Displays the _measure attribute on the widget params:

*args -> graphical instruction sent when the size has changed. Not used in the method.
MeasureWidget.getXPosition(note)¶

Returns the x coordinate of the note in the measure. params:

note (note.Note) -> note to display
MeasureWidget.getYPosition(note)¶

Returns the y coordinate of the note in the measure. params:

note (note.Note) -> note to display
MeasureWidget.setKey(flag)¶

Initializes the positionning for the key of the current note, depending of the flag params. params:

flag (boolean) -> true if it’s treble, false otherwise.
MeasureWidget.setMeasure(measure)¶

Sets the measure to display. The measure is saved in the _measure attribute. It updates note positions when the widget size is changed. params:

measure (stream.Measure) -> the measure to display
class gui.scorewidget.ScoreLayout(**kwargs)¶

Bases: kivy.uix.boxlayout.BoxLayout

Displays a score page. Contains a list of StaveWidget, displayed vertically.
class gui.scorewidget.ScoreWidget(**kwargs)¶

Bases: kivy.uix.pagelayout.PageLayout

Displays a complete score. A treble and bass clef are used to display 6 octaves. The score can be displayed on multiple pages.

Contains a list of ScoreLayout, displayed on its different pages

ScoreWidget.displayScore(score)¶

Displays the _score object on the widget. params:

score -> The score to display
ScoreWidget.init(measureNumber)¶

Inits the widgets architecure for the next score to display. Creates all the pages needed to display the score. Then, initializes the _measureWidget attribute. params:

measureNumber (int) -> number of measures in the score to display
ScoreWidget.initPages(nbPages)¶

Considering a given number of pages, resets the display of all existing needed pages. Then, pages are created/removed, depending of the needed number of page for the next score.

ScoreWidget.on_touch_up(touch)¶

This method fixes a kivy bug. The parent method is called only if there is more than two score pages. params:

touch -> the touch event
class gui.scorewidget.StaveLayout(**kwargs)¶

Bases: kivy.uix.boxlayout.BoxLayout

Displays a score stave. Contains a list of MeasureWidget, displayed horizontally

gui.screen module¶

class gui.screen.Manager¶

Bases: kivy.uix.screenmanager.ScreenManager

Class handling the transition beetween screens. Contains A RecordScreen and a ScoreScreen. A SlideTransition is used and the transition is started when a recording has been completed.

Manager.ANALYZED_FILE = 'temp.wav'¶
Manager.analyze()¶

Starts the analysis on the ANALYZED_FILE. Once the score is created, it displays it on the score screen

class gui.screen.PerfectMelodyApp(**kwargs)¶

Bases: kivy.app.App

Main class in the application.

PerfectMelodyApp.build()¶
class gui.screen.RecordScreen(**kw)¶

Bases: kivy.uix.screenmanager.Screen

The application’s record screen
class gui.screen.ScoreScreen(**kw)¶

Bases: kivy.uix.screenmanager.Screen

The application’s score display screen

ScoreScreen.setScore(score=None)¶

Displays a score on the score widget and defines the score to export/send/play into each button params:

score (music21.stream.Score) -> the score to display on the screen.
